text: Flor Isava Fonseca (20 May 1921 - 25 July 2020)Fallece Flor Isava, la eterna dama del olimpismo venezolano was a Venezuelan sportswoman, journalist and writer. She was the vice president of the Venezuelan Red Cross. In 1981, Isava-Fonseca and Finnish Pirjo HÃ¤ggman were the first women to be elected to the International Olympic Committee.International Olympic Committee Factsheet, June 2012 Retrieved 9 July 2013. She was the first woman to be on the executive board in 1990. Fonseca died on 25 July 2020, aged 99. ==References== Category:1921 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Venezuelan writers Category:Venezuelan journalists Category:International Olympic Committee
title: Flor Isava Fonseca
